title: The Truth About Chinese Bonds
sub_head: Beijing’s latest stab at financial reform is one of its riskiest.
body:
Here’s some advice for investors trying to make sense of recent turmoil in China’s domestic bond market: Good luck. Beijing appears to be gearing up for what could become one of its most consequential financial reforms, at a time when the economy is recovering from the pandemic.
China’s roughly $15 trillion domestic bond market has been upset by the defaults of two state-owned borrowers. Yongcheng Coal and Electricity Holding Co., owned by Henan’s provincial government, recently defaulted on a $152 million bond. Huachen Automotive...
